intro: Tauscheria gymnocarpa, commonly known as the naked-seed tauscheria, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region, particularly found in southern Europe and parts of North Africa. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. Its fruit is a dry, two-lobed capsule that lacks a prominent pericarp, giving it the common name "naked-seed." It is often grown in gardens for its ornamental value and historical use in herbal medicine.
